definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: I think my inspection is just some sort of formality.
sentences.chinese: 我要告诉我的客户，当不走过场起重重量。

sentences.english: I'm convinced the new method won't work but I'll still have to go through the motions .
sentences.chinese: 我深信这个新方法起不了什么作用，但仍还得走过场。

sentences.english: I like to tell my clients to not just go through the motion when lifting weights.
sentences.chinese: 我要告诉我的客户，当不走过场起重重量。

sentences.english: I'm not really into this project. I'm just going through the motions.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个项目并不感冒，只是走走过场而已。

sentences.english: Such thing is all about routines.
sentences.chinese: 这种事我们一般走走过场就完了。

sentences.english: Now I don't even go through the motions.
sentences.chinese: 如今，我甚至不愿去“走过场”。

sentences.english: You can't afford to just coast along, or go through the motions, if you're running a business.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在经营事业的话，你不能只是走走过场而已。

sentences.english: The economy has sufficient momentum that Beijing can muddle through with piecemeal reforms for now.
sentences.chinese: 经济动力充足，令北京暂时可靠零星改革来走过场。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, we don't take this kind of matter too serisouly.
sentences.chinese: 这种事我们一般走走过场就完了。

sentences.english: She's here to remind you that life is too short for simply going through the motions.
sentences.chinese: 它在提醒你，如果只是走走过场，生命可是太短暂了。

definition: to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)
to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
to do sth for show/to keep up appearances
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
